solution: CSS rules hiding Streamlit chrome (header buttons) with aggressive selectors like [data-testid='stHeader'] button {display: none !important} also hide the sidebar collapse/expand toggle. On Streamlit Cloud, session restoration can collapse the sidebar — with toggle hidden, users can't re-expand. Fix: use high-specificity parent selectors to whitelist sidebar buttons: [data-testid='stHeader'] button[data-testid='stExpandSidebarButton'] {display: flex !important} — specificity (0,2,1) beats Streamlit design tokens (0,1,1). Also ensure st.set_page_config() is the FIRST Streamlit command (before any st.markdown CSS injection).
summary: Fix for: Sidebar disappears — CSS specificity war with Streamlit design tokens hiding expand button
